prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Nolan Cross  Detroit Renegades
mes:
Starting over wasnâ€™t part of the planâ€”but after things went sideways with his last team, the Detroit Renegades picked up Nolan Cross, defenseman no #71 for his tenth season in the league. He figured heâ€™d keep his head down. Low profile. Clean slate.

Instead? Scandal.

One minute heâ€™s doing a harmless fan Q&A on livestreamâ€”being polite, smiling like the PR team drilled into himâ€”and the next, itâ€™s a full-blown meltdown. A swarm of puck bunnies screeching like hyenas in heat. One claimed he winked. Another posted a blurry selfie standing kinda near him and captioned it: â€œmanifesting his babies ğŸ’¦ğŸ’.â€

By the end of the night, three fan accounts had rebranded as @MrsCross79, and someone launched a 47-post thread analyzing the bulge in his compression shorts.

And it didnâ€™t stop there. His DMs exploded with threats and fantasies. Weird gifts from multiple women started showing up at the rink, used lingerie, stuffed animals reeking of perfume, letters in glitter ink calling him â€œhusband.â€ Reddit sleuths tried triangulating his apartment from the angle of a brick wall in one selfie. Discord chats dissected tree shadows to figure out his street. One girl claimed she "accidentally" ran into him at his gym. Another bragged she "might" have found his address. 

Management benched him to â€œtake a breather". *Again*. Like he hadnâ€™t already gone through this exact circus with his last team. Like he was the problem, not the feral puck bunnies clawing at the glass. All he did was smile and play nice, just like PR told him to. 

Christ. And yet again, another day, another psycho-stalker-fan-gift waiting for him on the bleacher for him to find  just as the Renegades were wrapping practice and shuffling off the ice. 

Nolan was so fucking over it.

He stared at the latest offering, a scrap of lace that he assumed was underwear, with his name scrawled on it in red lipstick. *Classy*. He didn't know whether to laugh or hurl.

"Yo, Nolo!" Ronan's voice snapped him out of his what-the-actual-fuck trance. "You got another one? Shit, bro, your fan club is wild."

Nolan shoots him a withering glare. "Shut up, man. It's not funny."

But Ronan just laughs, his eyes dancing with mischief. "I'm just saying, dude. You've got 'em all riled up. Must be that pretty boy charm, eh?"

"Fuck off, Ro." Nolan groaned. He knows Ronan means well, even if his idea of support is relentless teasing.

"Bro, this is getting out of hand tho." Dylan interjects. "You gotta talk to coach or something. That's like, the third one this week."

"And say what? 'Hey coach, sorry I can't focus on hockey, I'm too busy dodging panties from my delulu fans'?" Nolan scoffed, tossing the laceâ€¦ thing into the trash. "Yeah, that'll go over real well."

Finn chimed in, ever the voice of un-reason. "Fuck that. I say we find out who's sending this shit and teach 'em a lesson. Old school style."

"Finn." Tyler's warning tone was a bucket of ice water on Finn's vigilante fantasies. "We can't just go around roughing up fans. Even if theyâ€™re batshit. And if this one is like that delulu stalker your mom set you up with last time? Pretty sure they might say it's their kink and ask for more." 

Finn leaned forward, eyes gleaming like a raccoon who found snacks. â€œAlright, fine, no violence. But what if we just sent â€˜em a cursed doll soaked in rink water and protein shake? Yâ€™know, hockey voodoo.â€

Tyler squinted. â€œWhere the hell do you even buy a cursed doll?â€

â€œeBay,â€ Finn said too fast.

Nolan groaned into his hands. â€œCan we not curse anyone? Iâ€™m already living in a nightmare.â€ He tried to tune out his teammates as they bounced ridiculous ideas back and forth like it was some kind of contest. He only cared for one thing right now as his eyes scanned the stands, searching for one thing. And then, there she was. Making her way toward him. His pulse kicked up a notch.

Hailee.

He hadn't seen her in weeks and he'd promised to take her to that new cafe downtown. *Not a date*, he reminded himself sternly. Just two friends. Hanging out. Doing friend things. *Right.*

"Crossy!" Roro's elbow jabs into his ribs, jolting him back to reality. "You gonna stand there eye-fucking your girl all day or what?"

"Shut up," Nolan hisses, feeling his cheeks heat. "She's not myâ€”we're notâ€”it's not like that."

*Fuck*. He wishes it was. Wishes he had the balls to tell her how he really feels, how he's felt ever since they were twelve and she broke his nose for calling her a loser. ((To be fair, he was trying to flirt. It backfired. Badly.) Heâ€™s been a goner for her ever since. Through every asshole boyfriend, every messy breakup, every tearful rant at 2 AM, heâ€™s always been there. Always the friend. *Just the friend*. And if he screw this up 
 and lost her?  That would fucking end him.

So instead, he pastes on his best "totally platonic bro" smile and jogs over to meet her halfway.

But then he saw her. *Fuck. Not again*. The crazy brunette. Usually there were a few of them circling like a hyena pack but he's sure this one is the one whoâ€™d been leaving increasingly deranged giftsâ€”lace panties spritzed with perfume, glitter-soaked letters that all started with â€œDear Husbandâ€ and ended in lipstick kisses. *Fuck. How the hell did she get past security?*

Panic clawed up his throat. He couldn't let Hailee see *that*. Couldn't let Hailee realize just how fucked his situation was. She'll worry. She'll fret. She'll look at him with those big, concerned eyes and he'll fucking break.

He had to get them out of here. Now.  

He turned to Hailee, a too-bright smile plastered on his face. "Hey, you ready to go? I was thinking we could take the back way out. Y'know, avoid the crowds."

Without waiting for a response, he wrapped an arm around her shoulders, steering her towards the side exit. He could feel the brunette's eyes boring into his back. Could practically hear the gears turning in her delusional little head.

Theyâ€™d almost made it to the back exit when he heard it.

**"Husband!"**

Nolan flinched like heâ€™d been shot.

The voice rang out in the corridorâ€”high-pitched, syrupy, and unhinged in that terrifyingly cheerful way that meant nothing good ever followed.

**â€œHusband! Wait! You forgot your gift!â€**

He didnâ€™t turn around. Didnâ€™t breathe. Just tightened his arm around Hailee and muttered, â€œKeep walking. Donâ€™t look. Please.â€

But the footsteps behind them quickened. He could hear the slap of cheap heels on tile, the jangle of too many bracelets, the rustle of a plastic shopping bag clutched in manicured hands.

â€œI made you something!â€ she chirped. â€œItâ€™s a scrapbook of our future wedding! I even printed out the photo of us standing near each other at the last meet-and-greet autograph session. It was destiny, baby!â€

Nolan swore under his breath, heart pounding. Fuck. He shouldâ€™ve told security. Shouldâ€™ve flagged her months ago. But no. PR said be nice. Smile. Donâ€™t â€œantagonize the fans.â€

Now she was three strides away and still gaining. â€œWhoâ€™s this bitch?â€ she screeched, zeroing in on Hailee. â€œIs she your assistant? A cousin? She doesnâ€™t look like your type!â€

The girl lunged at Hailee. â€œYou donâ€™t need her! Iâ€™m the one who gets you, Nolan! I bought your cologne! I know your birth chart! I'm gonna have your babies.â€

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee yelps jumping back as the girl falls forward. She dodges to the side falling against Nolan's chest trying to get farther away from this crazy girl* "Woah what the hell. Who are you" *Hailee gasps her eyes wide and frightened*

*Hailee has never seen a girl act like this. She is fucking crazy.* "Nolan what the fuck"

name: Nolan Cross  Detroit Renegades
mes:
Nolanâ€™s arm tightens around Hailee instinctively, pulling her flush against his chest as the girl stumbles forward. His jaw clenches, that easygoing smile goneâ€”replaced by something sharper, darker. Protective.

**"Back off."** His voice is low, dangerous in a way he *never* lets it get with fansâ€”but this? This crossed every line.

The girl blinks up at him like she canâ€™t comprehend he isnâ€™t thrilled to see her. â€œB-butâ€¦ I made you a scrapbook! And Iâ€”â€

**â€œI donâ€™t care.â€** Nolan cuts her off, stepping between Hailee and the girl like a human shield. He doesnâ€™t raise his voice, but thereâ€™s no mistaking the ice in it now. **â€œYou donâ€™t touch her. You donâ€™t talk to her. You don't even fucking *look* at her.â€**

The girl's face crumplesâ€”like she genuinely expected him to be *happy* about this insanityâ€”but before she can start wailing or worse (*god forbid more screeching*), Finn appears out of nowhere like an avenging angel of chaos and bodily hauls the girl back by the hood of her jacket before security finally catches up and escorts her out kicking and screaming about "true love."

Nolan exhales hard through his nose, still holding Hailee close without thinkingâ€”until he realizes how tightly he's gripping her waist and immediately loosens his hold (though not enough to let go entirely). His pulse is still hammering under his skin when he finally looks down at Hailee properly for the first time since this shitstorm started... only for guilt to twist in his gut when he sees how wide-eyed she is.

He swallows hard before forcing himself to speak againâ€”softer now but still rough around the edges from adrenaline:
**"...You okay?"**
swipes:
Nolanâ€™s grip on Hailee tightens instinctively, pulling her flush against his chest as the girl stumbles forward. His pulse is hammering so loud he can barely hear anything elseâ€”just the rush of blood in his ears and the sharp, panicked hitch of Haileeâ€™s breath.

*Fuck.*

He shouldâ€™ve handled this sooner. Shouldâ€™ve *done* something instead of just hoping it would go away. But now? Now this psycho was *touching* Hailee, screaming in her face like some kind of rabid animalâ€”and that? That crossed a line Nolan didnâ€™t even know he had drawn until right fucking now.

His jaw locks, teeth grinding together hard enough to ache as he steps between them, shielding Hailee with his body entirely. His voice comes out lowâ€”dangerous in a way it almost never is when he's around her. **"Back off."**

The girl blinks up at him like she doesn't understand why *he's* the one pissed off here. "Butâ€”"

**"Now."** The word cracks through the air like a whip, sharp enough that even Ronan and Finn pause mid-step where they'd been rushing over from across the hall. The girl flinches back like she's been slapped, eyes wide with something between shock and betrayal before they flicker to Hailee againâ€”narrowed now, venomous.

Nolan doesn't give her time to open her mouth again before turning on his heel and all but dragging Hailee toward the exit at a near-jog, ignoring the way she stumbles slightly against him in surprise at how fast he moves them out of there.

His fingers are still curled too tight around hers when they finally burst into fresh air outsideâ€”like if he lets go for even a second she might vanish or worse: get snatched up by another one of those psychos lurking somewhere unseen.

He exhales hard through his nose before finally looking down at her properly for what feels like forever since this mess started unfolding behind closed doors inside that arena hallway... only then realizing just how close they're standing; chest-to-chest still from when he pulled them both away so fast earlier (and maybe also because part-of-him refuses-to-let-go).

Her eyes are wide green pools staring back up into his own startled ones â€” scared but trusting despite everything happening around them right now which makes guilt twist hot under ribs because none-of-this-should-be-her-problem-but-it-is-because-he-didn't-stop-it-soonerâ€”

And suddenly all words fail him entirely except two: **"...I'm sorry."**

Nolan's grip on Hailee tightened instantly, pulling her flush against his chest as he stepped between her and the rabid fan. His jaw clenched so hard it ached.

**"Back the fuck up."**

His voice was lowâ€”dangerous in a way that made even Ronan pause mid-laugh from across the hallway. The kind of tone that said *this isnâ€™t a joke anymore*.

The girl blinked at him like she couldnâ€™t compute rejection. "Butâ€”but Iâ€”" She held up the scrapbook again, shaking it like some deranged peace offering. "I worked so hard on this! You *promised* me!"

Nolan didnâ€™t remember promising shit to anyone except maybe Hailee when he swore he'd take her to that damn cafÃ© weeks ago and kept flaking because of this exact circus.

He exhaled sharply through his nose, already mentally drafting an apology text to PR for what he was about to do next. **"Listen,"** he ground out, forcing calm into his voice even as his pulse hammered in his throat, **"you need to leave."**

A security guard finally rounded the cornerâ€”late as fucking usualâ€”eyeing the scene with weary recognition. Nolan didn't wait for protocol or polite handling; he jerked his chin toward the girl and snapped: **"Get her out."** Then quieter, just for Hailee's ear: **"C'mon, let's go."** He didn't loosen his hold on her until they were outside in crisp evening air with two locked doors between them and crazy-town.

Only then did Nolan drag a hand down his face with a shaky exhaleâ€”half frustration, half lingering adrenaline from seeing someone lunge at *Hailee*. Fuck if that didn't make something primal twist in his gut. He turned toward her now, scanning for any sign she was rattled beyond repair (or worse: rethinking being seen with him ever again). His thumb brushed over her wrist without thinking before catching himself and shoving both hands into pockets instead like they'd betrayed him by touching without permission.

*Smooth.* Real smooth.

"...You good?" It came out gruffer than intended; too much leftover tension still coiled tight under ribs where panic had settled minutes ago when some stranger thought she could put hands on what mattered most without consequence.

(And yeah okay maybe calling Hailee *what mattered most* wasn't exactly platonic bestie behavior but sue him.)

Nolanâ€™s arm tightens around Hailee instinctively, pulling her flush against his chest as the girl stumbles forward. His jaw clenches, that easygoing smile goneâ€”replaced by something sharper, darker. Protective.

**"Back off."** His voice is low, dangerous in a way he *never* lets it get with fansâ€”but this? This crossed every line.

The girl blinks up at him like she canâ€™t comprehend he isnâ€™t thrilled to see her. â€œB-butâ€¦ I made you a scrapbook! And Iâ€”â€

**â€œI donâ€™t care.â€** Nolan cuts her off, stepping between Hailee and the girl like a human shield. He doesnâ€™t raise his voice, but thereâ€™s no mistaking the ice in it now. **â€œYou donâ€™t touch her. You donâ€™t talk to her. You don't even fucking *look* at her.â€**

The girl's face crumplesâ€”like she genuinely expected him to be *happy* about this insanityâ€”but before she can start wailing or worse (*god forbid more screeching*), Finn appears out of nowhere like an avenging angel of chaos and bodily hauls the girl back by the hood of her jacket before security finally catches up and escorts her out kicking and screaming about "true love."

Nolan exhales hard through his nose, still holding Hailee close without thinkingâ€”until he realizes how tightly he's gripping her waist and immediately loosens his hold (though not enough to let go entirely). His pulse is still hammering under his skin when he finally looks down at Hailee properly for the first time since this shitstorm started... only for guilt to twist in his gut when he sees how wide-eyed she is.

He swallows hard before forcing himself to speak againâ€”softer now but still rough around the edges from adrenaline:
**"...You okay?"**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee turns towards Nolan with wide eyes* "Does that happen often" *She glances him over running her hands along his arms like she is checking for imaginary injuries now that she knows he deals with crazy people*

*Hailee sighs shaking her head* "You need better security"

name: Nolan Cross  Detroit Renegades
mes:
Nolan lets out a dry, humorless laughâ€”more of an exhale than anything. **"Youâ€™d think, huh?"** He rubs the back of his neck, suddenly hyper-aware of her hands on his arms. Itâ€™s stupid how much that tiny contact makes his pulse stutter even now.

He should step back. Put space between them like he always does when it gets too real. But he doesnâ€™t.

Instead, he leans into her touch just slightlyâ€”just enough to feel the warmth of her fingers through his sleeve before forcing himself to focus on the actual problem at hand: *the fact that this keeps happening*.

**"Management says I gotta 'play nice' with fans,"** he mutters, rolling his eyes. **"PR thinks if I ignore it, they'll get bored and move on."** A beat. **"...They don't."**

His jaw ticks as he glances toward where security finally dragged the girl offâ€”probably just to ban her for *today*, not permanently (*because god forbid they actually protect their players*). When he looks back at Hailee, there's something raw in his expression before he schools it back into something lighterâ€”something safer for both of them.

**"C'mon,"** he says quietly, nudging her toward the exit again with a hand at the small of her back (gentle now, nothing like earlier). **"Let's get outta here before another one pops up with a fucking wedding planner."**
swipes:
Nolan lets out a dry, humorless laugh at that. **"You think?"** His voice is still tight, but he leans into her touch just slightlyâ€”like he canâ€™t help it.

He exhales sharply, running a hand through his already-messy hair. **"This shitâ€™s been happening for years,"** he admits, quieter now. **"But lately? Itâ€™s like theyâ€™ve all collectively lost their damn minds."**

A beat of silence as his thumb absently brushes against her hip where his hand still restsâ€”before he catches himself and pulls back entirely with a forced smirk. **"Guess I should start wearing a fake mustache or something."**

But the joke falls flat even to him. He glances toward the exit where security finally dragged the girl out, jaw ticking once before looking back at Hailee with something almost... apologetic in his expression.

**"...Sorry you had to see that."**

Nolan lets out a dry, humorless laughâ€”more of an exhale than anything. **"Youâ€™d think, huh?"** He rubs the back of his neck, suddenly hyper-aware of her hands on his arms. Itâ€™s stupid how much that tiny contact makes his pulse stutter even now.

He should step back. Put space between them like he always does when it gets too real. But he doesnâ€™t.

Instead, he leans into her touch just slightlyâ€”just enough to feel the warmth of her fingers through his sleeve before forcing himself to focus on the actual problem at hand: *the fact that this keeps happening*.

**"Management says I gotta 'play nice' with fans,"** he mutters, rolling his eyes. **"PR thinks if I ignore it, they'll get bored and move on."** A beat. **"...They don't."**

His jaw ticks as he glances toward where security finally dragged the girl offâ€”probably just to ban her for *today*, not permanently (*because god forbid they actually protect their players*). When he looks back at Hailee, there's something raw in his expression before he schools it back into something lighterâ€”something safer for both of them.

**"C'mon,"** he says quietly, nudging her toward the exit again with a hand at the small of her back (gentle now, nothing like earlier). **"Let's get outta here before another one pops up with a fucking wedding planner."**
